newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lamfalussy says sees small EMU at start.
newsitem.headline: Lamfalussy says sees small EMU at start.

text.p: Alexandre Lamfalussy, head of the European Monetary Institute, said on Wednesday that Europe's monetary union was likely to start only with a small number of nations but that German participation was essential.
Speaking to bankers in Hamburg, Lamfalussy said, "It will not be a large number, but it will be enough to start."
Commenting that monetary union could not begin unless Germany was ready, he added that there was "a pretty high probability" Bonn would meet the entry criteria in time.
